comments:
The following error occurs when a query return a task description with a '%' sign. It seems the URL decoder does not like it (which makes sense, since % has a special meaning in URLs).

-- Error Log --
Date: Wed Dec 06 10:25:32 CET 2006
Message: An internal error occurred during: "Synchronizing queries: web".
Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.core.jobs
Stack Trace:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: URLDecoder: Illegal hex characters in escape (%) pattern - For input string: "&#"
at java.net.URLDecoder.decode(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.web.WebRepositoryConnector.cleanup(WebRepositoryConnector.java:273)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.web.WebRepositoryConnector.performQuery(WebRepositoryConnector.java:251)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.web.WebRepositoryConnector.performQuery(WebRepositoryConnector.java:189)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeQueryJob.run(SynchronizeQueryJob.java:71)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Eugene, let me know if you can't mark it as duplicate.

I only can do this if I am the reporter or assignee...

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 166737 ***

traces.message: URLDecoder: Illegal hex characters in escape (%) pattern - For input string: "&#"
